text: Francesco Cini (1610 - May 1684) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Macerata e Tolentino (1660–1684). (in Latin) ==Biography== Francesco Cini was born in Osimo, Italy in 1610 and ordained as a priest on 26 September 1660. On 15 November 1660, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Alexander VII as Bishop of Macerata e Tolentino. On 21 November 1660, he was consecrated bishop by Giulio Cesare Sacchetti, Cardinal-Bishop of Sabina, with Ottaviano Carafa, Titular Archbishop of Patrae, and Giovanni Agostino Marliani, Bishop Emeritus of Accia and Mariana, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Macerata e Tolentino until his death in May 1684. ==See also== *Catholic Church in Italy ==References== ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Alexander VII Category:1610 births Category:1684 deaths
title: Francesco Cini
